image.altText: A digital render of a train station at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: Melburnians could be able to catch a train to the airport within six years, after Melbourne Airport agrees to back down on its demands for the railway station to be built underground.

title.children: 'Victorians have waited long enough': Melbourne Airport backs down in rail link standoff

image.altText: A photograph of a brown coloured model of a human brain

props.synopsis: Two women who endured decades of intimate partner violence have been diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy — the first cases of CTE in victims of domestic violence in Australia and two of just a handful globally.

title.children: CTE found in two domestic violence victims who suffered dozens of head injuries before they died

image.altText: A bag of heroin in an unidentifiable hand.

props.synopsis: Synthetic opioids like fentanyl and nitazenes are already finding their way into Australia's drug supply. Experts are concerned surges in the drug could have fatal consequences and are calling on the government to prepare.

title.children: Experts release plan to head off potentially fatal overdoses as fentanyl and nitazenes hit Victorian drug market

image.altText: People hug

props.synopsis: French politicians are surprised by a swing to the left as parliamentary polls close, despite a predicted far-right surge. The snap parliamentary election was called by president Emmanuel Macron last month. Follow live.

title.children: Leftist leader expresses 'immense relief' as France makes surprise swing away from far right

image.altText: Man in military holds drone

props.synopsis: A lightweight US-made drone that carries an explosive payload and fits in a backpack will soon enter service with the Australian Defence Force following its successful use on the battlefield in Ukraine.

title.children: Australian military to buy small US-made lethal drones being used by Ukrainian forces

image.altText: two photos of a blonde thin woman

props.synopsis: Renee was last seen outside a home in the city's west on June 2, where she asked for water and clothing.

title.children: Police renew plea for information on Ballarat woman missing for more than a month

image.altText: Police officer and car seen outside brick house with charred windows

props.synopsis: A three-year-old and six-year-old boy, as well as a 10-month-old girl, died after the fire in Sydney's west on Sunday.

title.children: Father of three children killed in Western Sydney house fire remains in coma, police waiting to interview him

image.altText: a woman holds a framed picture of a young girl looks at the camera while sitting indoors at a house

props.synopsis: Four years ago, 10-year-old Bridgette Porter was killed. On the anniversary of her death, her parents are campaigning for justice through Biddy's Voice.

title.children: Parents of 10-year-old murder victim seek to reclaim daughter's identity

image.altText: Dane Gagai is hugged by Queensland Maroons teammates after scoring a State of Origin try against the NSW Blues.

props.synopsis: Billy Slater will explain his team for the State of Origin series decider after NSW coach Michael Maguire explained the changes he made for Game III at Lang Park. Follow in our live blog.

title.children: Queensland recalls Origin superstars for Game III as Maroons reshuffle team for decider

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Queensland Maroons team for State of Origin III confirmed
The Maroons team will be revealed at 9am AEST
NSW coach Michael Maguire explains the changes

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: After more than four years of closure, there are positive signs that one of Kakadu National Park's most popular sites could soon be reopened to the public.

title.children: Kakadu traditional owners receive personal apology at Gunlom Falls over sacred site damage

image.altText: red first sand dunes and muddy claypan

props.synopsis: Parts of the state's far west record up to 10 times their average July rainfall, in what the weather bureau has described as an "unusual" winter drenching.

title.children: Winter rainfall topples decades-old July weather record in outback Queensland

image.altText: A large crowd of people stands on a train platform.

props.synopsis: The time it takes Australian workers to get to work is increasing. What do experts think will help improve them?

title.children: How do Australian work commutes compare to the US and Europe?

image.altText: A small doll next to a pin cushion on a silk white pillow. A hand with a blue glove places the pin cushion down

props.synopsis: When an archives manager in England stumbled upon a small black doll, she was puzzled. A clue pointed her to Tasmania and a girl called Mithina, who lived almost 200 years ago.

title.children: This doll belonged to an Aboriginal girl in Tasmania. How did it end up in a box in England?

image.altText: Gabriel Attal

props.synopsis: In a pivotal run-off election in France, polling projections say a left-leaning coalition has won the most parliamentary seats, while President Emmanuel Macron's centrist alliance will come second and the far right third.

title.children: France's far-right National Rally loses parliamentary election, early polling indicates

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Wall Street's S&P 500 and Nasdaq indices closed on Friday at record levels, but the ASX is looking unlikely to follow that lead. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to slip on opening despite Wall Street closing again at record highs

image.altText: man in woole beanie and check top stands on jetty smiling off camera

props.synopsis: Separated from his community and culture, this Port Lincoln elder became a hero when he saved his friend from drowning.

title.children: Hayden was 14 when he heard screams for help. More than 60 years on, his heroics have been recognised

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair outdoors using a smartphone

props.synopsis: NDIS Minister Bill Shorten confirms he will ban sex work from being accessed through the disability insurance scheme, which advocates say would rob participants of the freedom to control their own lives.

title.children: 'Not a sustainable proposition': Government to block sex work services from NDIS

image.altText: F1 driver Lewis Hamilton shouts in celebration as he hoists a large gold trophy in the air, while a big group of fans watch.

props.synopsis: It's taken the best part of three years, but Lewis Hamilton is back on the top step of an F1 podium, delighting British fans with a dramatic win at Silverstone.

title.children: Lewis Hamilton ends wait for F1 win with brilliant British GP victory at Silverstone

image.altText: AFLart (1)

props.synopsis: Logan McDonald the culprit again as Sydney drops two straight, Damien Hardwick's big reality check to the Suns, and Essendon ticks a massive box. Here are the key talking points from Round 17 in the AFL.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Swans star's demons resurface, a brutal Hardwick spray, and Dons pass major test

image.altText: Sydney Roosters' Jared Waerea-Hargreaves, Melbourne Storm's Jack Howarth, and Cronulla Sharks' Nicho Hynes.

props.synopsis: Round 18 gave us two golden-point games in one day, a tribute to a living legend, the emergence of a rising star and the return of another. Here's this week's NRL Round-Up.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Double golden points, the return of Reece and another tough night for Nicho

image.altText: a stack of romance novels with the front book showing artwork of a woman and man kissing.

props.synopsis: Social media is opening up the world of romantic fiction to teens and it's giving them new perspectives on love.

title.children: Young readers are falling in love with romance novels and it's shaping their views on relationships

image.altText: A night time photo of a Queensland Police Service car with its blue light illuminated.

props.synopsis: Police find three children reported missing from the Gold Coast safe and well, while a man known to the children is assisting with the investigation into their disappearance.

title.children: Police cancel alert after missing Gold Coast children found, man in custody

image.altText: A person in a hazmat suit stands between two cars in a driveway, with a burnt out house in the background.

props.synopsis: Three young children have died overnight after a house fire at Lalor Park in Sydney's west.

title.children: Police allege father blocked rescuers trying to save children from fatal house fire that killed three

image.altText: A bridge at night with street lamps turned on above it

props.synopsis: NT Police are urging any eyewitnesses to come forward with information after the incident, which happened on a walkway crossing the town's Todd River in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Curfew being considered after off-duty police officers allegedly assaulted by 20 youths in Alice Springs

image.altText: Mehreen Faruqi refuses to be drawn on dismantling Hamas

props.synopsis: Greens deputy Mehreen Faruqi says it should be left to Palestinians to decide whether to dismantle Hamas, as she also makes claims that ex-Labor senator Fatima Payman is being "vilified" by her former party.

title.children: 'Not up to me': Greens deputy won't say whether Hamas should be dismantled

image.altText: A woman folding her arms in front of a vacant block of land

props.synopsis: The NSW government is accused of breaking an election promise by selling prime land in inner-city Sydney to private developers with no requirement for any social or affordable housing to be built.

title.children: Prime land close to Sydney CBD sold to developers with no requirement to build affordable housing

image.altText: A fair-skinned man, Dave, in an orange hi-vis shirt and akubra smiles and leans on a pecan tree.

props.synopsis: Riverland farmer Dave Otto de Grancy wanted "something that would stand the test of the weather", so he turned to pecan trees 16 years ago. Now, the nuts yield $80 a kilogram.

title.children: When life gave this farmer frosty oranges and grapes, he planted pecans to make gelato instead

image.altText: A barista performs coffee art while pouring milk from a jug into a cup of coffee.

props.synopsis: Environmental advocacy groups have raised concerns about chemical solvents used in decaf coffee. Should we be worried?

title.children: Drinking decaf can seem like a healthy choice, but is it?

image.altText: An army camouflage pattern in the background with a female silhouette in profile overlaid.

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force and Victoria Police confirm investigations are underway after a trainee alleges she was raped by a fellow member in 2023.

title.children: ADF and Victoria Police investigating after trainee alleges she was raped by fellow member

image.altText: Angie King marries Eric Burdon

props.synopsis: Jet James was eight when his mother died tragically. His journey back from childhood trauma led him in an unexpected direction.

title.children: Jet's mother was a sixties model who married rock royalty but her life met a tragic end

image.altText: A large stack of logs inside a shed

props.synopsis: Australia's once-booming sandalwood industry appears to be in terminal decline with Quintis and Santanol, Australia's two largest producers, both being sold off.

title.children: Synonymous with high-end perfume and other luxuries, Australia's sandalwood industry is on its last legs

image.altText: Gordon Dedman in the bush drinking from a native plant

props.synopsis: In an age shrouded with uncertainty, courses in wilderness survival and military tactics are booming. But concerns about operators in a field with little-to-no industry oversight has some trainers concerned.

title.children: Survival skill instructors warn of 'charlatan' operators in underregulated but booming industry
